rewards.content: You finished your story early. You advance 2 squares.
Your test was satisfactory. You advance 2 squares.
You did a great teamwork today. You can roll the dices again.
Your team solved a bug. You can advance 1 extra square.
You helped your coworker on a difficult assignment. To thank you, the player immediately before you exchanges places with you.
The assignment you had was solved earlier than expected. You can roll the dices again.
The client asked for a new requirement, and you solved it correctly. You can roll doubles.
You were able to identify bugs from no bugs, you saved time to your team. You can advance 5 squares.
Did you work extra time? No way! You immediately need a reward and a slice of pizza. Go on 6 squares.
You documented the solution very well when fixing a bug and it can be used as a reference to fix future bugs. You can advance 3 squares.

As a Scrum Master you organized the daily and a developer decided to ignore the email with the notification, he failed the meeting, so he/she/they are/is going to have a punishment. Select a player that will lose a turn.
You have achieved all your objectives in time in the project, roll one dice again and advance double the number obtained.
In the sprint review all the team congratulates you for having good results during the sprint, you can advance 2 squares.
Your team solved the bug, all players move one space forward.
You completed your tasks for the day in a timely manner, move forward 3 cells.
You successfully notified the developers about a bug and suggested a possible solution, you can advance to the place where the next player is and the players ahead of you lose a turn.
Your inner team solved the quests earlier than expected. You and a player of your choice will advance 2 squares.
You fixed a difficult bug that was slowing down the project. You can roll dices again.
Your team solved the bug, all players move one space forward.
You were an early bird, congrats! You move forward 3 squares.

punishments.content: You arrived late to the daily scrum meeting. You must get back 2 squares to think about what you did.
You accidentally deleted the database. You must lose a turn to rebuild the database.
You got assigned a new bug. You lose a turn to solve it.
You didn’t follow the agile methodology as you were supposed to. We will give you some time to check it again, you must get back 2 squares.
Your deploy got delayed. You must get back 3 squares.
You didn’t listen carefully to the client’s requirements. To fulfill the requirements, you must lose 1 turn.
You weren’t being a team player with your coworkers. To make amends you exchange places with the player immediately after you.
You didn’t communicate on time and that made the project delayed. You get back 3 squares.
You had the chance to ask for help but you didn’t, so that made the story delayed. You get back 2 squares.
Your time estimation was wrong. You need 1 extra turn to complete your story. You lose 1 turn.
Are you trying to leave an important task for tomorrow? Think twice, that could delay the team's progress. You get back 3 squares.
You forgot to document when you were fixing a bug and your computer crashed, losing all the progress you had. You need to dance “La Pelusa” for punishment (or lose 2 turns).
You went on vacation even though you were not approved, and you didn’t make it to the sprint. You lose 1 turn.
After taking an extra work shift trying to solve a major problem, you went home tired and fell asleep. You missed your alarm clock causing you to fail to arrive at work. You lose 1 turn.
The bugs were stronger than you today, maybe tomorrow you’ll beat them. For now, move back 1 square.
Your team has not completed the task, all the players move back one square.
You left the test to the end and this caused the development time to lengthen. You lose 1 turn to work on it.
You did not communicate during the daily meeting that you had an impediment to do a task so you didn’t finish the task on time. Get back 4 squares.
You worked more hours than allowed. Take a break for one turn.
You mixed up “bug” as “insect” and that causes your team to have confusions. To clear your head, you must go back 2 squares.
